intro: Lastrea squamipes, commonly known as the sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular, two-lipped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or arid regions. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
